column8: text

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Abdul Razak greets members of the Malaysian Tamil Youth Bell Club at the Grand Hall, Lukut, on Jan 22, 2016Datuk Seri Najib Abdul Razak has denied that MCA had requested for the post of deputy prime minister to be given to the party as claimed by Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad.The Prime Minister said throughout his tenure as the country's number one leader, never once did the Barisan Nasional (BN) component party asked to be given the number two post and the post of Finance Minister."Recently it was revealed that DAP asked for the post of DPM and Finance Minister, when the Malays are angry, he said MCA. Since I became PM, MCA never asked for the DPM post, This is a lie."I deny and I ask MCA to also deny. MCA has three ministerial posts and they are thankful. Don't do a lot of U-turn," he said.Najib said this in his speech at a luncheon in conjunction with the 60th anniversary of the Malaysian Tamil Youth Bell Club at the Grand Hall, Lukut here today.Also present were MIC President Datuk Seri Dr S.Subramaniam, Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan, Dewan Negara Speaker Datuk Seri SA Vigneswaran, MyPPP President Tan Sri M Kayveas, MIC former president Datuk Seri S. Samy Vellu and Gerakan Vice President Datuk A. Kohilan Pillay.Previously Dr Mahathir was quoted to have said DAP wanted the post of deputy prime minister if the opposition pact wins the coming 14th General Election.In his blog on Friday, the former prime minister made a U turn by correcting his earlier statement that MCA was the party that asked for the post and not DAP.Speaking before a 3,000-strong audience, Najib, however, urged the people not to be influenced by the opposition's propaganda which frequently made U turns."Don't listen to the opposition, our statesman is taking rubbish now. He says want to abolish the GST (Goods and Services Tax) which gives a revenue of RM41 billion."Where do I get money to build clinics, hospitals? Imagine health asks, education asks, how do I get? Money does not come floating, it must come from resources," he said.Najib said the people needed to understand that the opposition could say whatever they want and often make a U turn if problems arise.Earlier the Prime Minister said the people, especially youths in the country must have a sophisticated mind, world class, borderless thinking and knowledgeable to compete in the future."But if knowledge is not aligned to morals, values and culture, intellect alone is meaningless. We want both at once."We want to be rooted in good value, rooted in our own culture in our history ... to strengthen our identity but our mind must internationalise our mind," he said.Najib also said even though the Indian community made up only 7.4% of Malaysia's population, the Indians had made many contributions to national development."Based on history, it cannot be denied the Indian community made great contributions and we should recognise the contribution of the Indian community," he said.The Malaysian Tamil Youth Bell Club was formed in 1956 to promote the Tamil language, arts and culture and has 24,552 members and 292 branches nationwide.At the function, Najib presented a cheque, worth RM2.18 million, for the construction of Tamil schools in the state, which was received by Mohamad. — Bernamahttp://www.thesundaily.my/news/2136169

Errrm.....http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...-minister-post/MCA admits it asked for deputy prime minister postFaiz Zainudin | January 21, 2017On that, Mahathir was right, but he was bringing it up for the wrong reasons, says key MCA leader.Ti-Lian-Ker_mca_600_2PETALING JAYA: MCA admits it has asked the prime minister for an additional deputy prime minister’s post to be created and filled by an MCA president.But MCA central committee member Ti Lian Ker said that in doing this, it was only relaying the wishes of its members.Speaking to FMT, he said the suggestion was made to enhance the government’s efforts to look after the interests of the non-Malays and non-Muslims of the country.“Actually, MCA was only relaying the wishes of the Chinese for a deputy prime minister’s post as an effort to resolve the problems faced by the non-Malays and non-Muslims,” Ti said.He said former prime minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad had made it seem that MCA was only seeking to provoke the Malays and that MCA had done wrong and that DAP was more sensitive towards Malay sentiments.“This is Mahathir’s politics for you. He tries to gain support from opposition parties by playing up racial sentiments.”Ti was responding to Mahathir’s statement, in which the Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia chairman said it was MCA, and not DAP, which asked for a deputy prime minister’s post.Previously, Mahathir had said that DAP had asked for a deputy prime minister’s post, only to correct himself after his initial statement was refuted by DAP secretary-general Lim Guan Eng.In 2009, MCA deputy secretary-general Loke Yuen Yow had asked Prime Minister Najib Razak to create an additional deputy chief minister’s post and an additional Barisan Nasional deputy chairman’s post to reflect “true power sharing”.At that time Loke said the creation of the additional deputy prime minister’s post would also show that the government acknowledged the role and contribution of the Chinese community to nation building.The deputy prime minister’s post has been filled by an Umno leader since the first cabinet of Malaya was set up in 1955.In the 2008 general election, BN’s poor performance saw the coalition lose a lot of ground to the opposition and also lose four states: Selangor, Penang, Kedah and Perak.MCA and other non-Malay component parties lost nearly half of their parliamentary and state seats.The opposition continued to win greater support from the Chinese in the 2013 general election and MCA had to settle for only seven parliamentary seats.
